titleStmt.title: A TEI Schema for Corpora of Parliamentary Proceedings

info.p: "A schema that can be used for encoding of parliamentary proceedings corpora, primarily for the purposes of scholarly investigations, and that could serve as a storage and interchange format for such corpora. These recommendations attempt to take into account the following aspects of PPC (parliamentary proceedings corpora):

ul.li: Structure: legislative periods, sessions, topics, speeches, transcription variants
Metadata: mandates, titles, parliamentary bodies, locations, dates and times
Speakers: sex, date of birth, education, party membership, links to external resources
Speeches: speaker, text, comments, verbal interruptions, (non-)verbal incidents
Linguistic annotation: PoS tagging, normalisation, syntax etc.
Multimedia: audio and video, facsimile of original

info.p: The recommendations are implemented as a parameterisation of the TEI Guidelines." (Parla-CLARIN GitHub pages, see below)

ul.li: Description of the format (at CLARIN-ERIC GitHub pages)
ParlaMint, which is a specialisation of PARLA-CLARIN, tightening the schema to increase interoperability among the encoded corpora
